Crashing is a technique that looks at cost and schedule trade-offs. Crashing is typically
implemented by adding more resources to the critical path tasks in order to complete the
project more quickly. Crashing can also be accomplished by requiring mandatory
overtime for those team members working on critical path tasks or by speeding up
delivery times from team members, vendors, and so on.

questions.question_text:
A project manager is managing a project with a hard deadline in two weeks. At the current rate of progress, the project will not finish on time.
Which of the following techniques is MOST likely to be used to complete the project on time?

A project manager has been experiencing resistance from a group of stakeholders.
With which of the following should the project manager consult to reduce friction going forward?

comments.content:
C. Project sponsor

When a project manager is experiencing resistance from a group of stakeholders, it is important to identify the root cause of the resistance and develop a plan to address it. One way to do this is to consult with the project sponsor, who has the authority and influence to help resolve conflicts and overcome resistance. The project sponsor can work with the project manager to understand the stakeholders' concerns and interests, and develop a strategy to address them. In contrast, the project scheduler and project coordinator are typically responsible for specific aspects of the project's execution, and may not have the authority or perspective to address stakeholder resistance. The project management office (PMO) is responsible for ensuring that project management processes, methodologies, and tools are followed consistently across the organization, but may not have direct involvement in the day-to-day management of individual projects.

discussion.content: Sponsors have the vision and controls the purse, but isn't it the PMO's responsibility to lay ground rules and enforcement policies?
